entry.title: Combined summary - Unit tests
entry.summary: On July 30, 2011, Matt Corallo suggested adding more tests to the boost testing framework implementation. Rick Wesson recommended using googletest as his choice of C++ frameworks and putting a bounty on the test framework to add more value to it. In the same thread, JS pointed out an issue with the unit test framework, which did not build by default. Two ways to fix the issue were suggested: adding #define BOOST_TEST_DYN_LINK to the top of test_bitcoin.cpp or linking boost_unit_test_framework statically.John Smith discusses the issue with the unit test framework not building by default and lists two ways to fix it. The first way involves adding #define BOOST_TEST_DYN_LINK to the top of test_bitcoin.cpp, which is necessary for dynamic linking. The second solution is to link boost_unit_test_framework statically, but this requires a switch to dynamic at the end to avoid errors. Matt suggests checking out pull requests 363 and 442 for further information regarding changes.The conversation between the individuals appears to be related to a software development project where they are discussing changes to code or adding new features. Pull requests are used to propose changes and have them reviewed before being merged into the main codebase. John expresses frustration with tests being spread out across different forks and wishes for greater organization within the testing process to simplify things moving forward. The approval of pull requests 363 and 442 would seemingly help address some of these concerns.
